alert.note: Alert for Eastern Ulster; Western Dutchess; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 5:25PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Ulster and northwestern Dutchess Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 524 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near West Hurley, or 7 miles west of Kingston, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Kingston, Saugerties, Rhinebeck, Hurley, Woodstock, Kenneth L Wilson Campground, Lake Katrine, West Hurley, Saugerties South, Olivebridge, Port Ewen, Marbletown, Veteran, Centerville, Rolling Meadows, Glenford, Atwood, Shultis Corners, Sweet Meadows and Pacama. This includes Interstate 87 between exits 19 and 20. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to ponding of water on roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Ulster; Western Dutchess; Western Ulster
